messageBody:
> Personally, I think this would be great functionality to have
> in the core of JUnit4.
>
> So, why am I wrong? :)

I agree with you. Not content to wait for JUnit4, I rolled my own using
annotations and com.gargoylesoftware.base.testing.TestFilter. So now I
annotate my test classes like this:

@YetiAnnotations(testGroups = { "nightly", "quick" })

Everything annotated to be in the "quick" test group gets executed as
part of our CruiseControl CI build. Everything in the "nightly" test
group gets executed - you guessed it - every per night.

I even built test filters to do AND and OR and the like, so I can easily
build a test suite that, for example, includes all my tests that are in
the com.polycom.foo package, annotated with "loadtest" but not annotated
with "nightly".


Todd.
